quiz.banner_desc: Join the <1>Discord Group</1> to discuss quizzes and any topics about Ark Nova!

abilities.clever_description: After finishing you may place any Action card on {Slot-1} .
abilities.sun_bathing_description: You may sell up to {} card(s) from your hand for {Money-4} each.
abilities.pouch_description: You may place {} card(s) from your hand under this card to gain {Appeal-2} .
abilities.hunter_description: Reveal the {} topmost card(s) of the deck. Choose 1 Animal card and add it to your hand. Discard the other cards.
abilities.pack_description: Gain {Appeal-1} for each predator icon in your zoo.
abilities.pack_prehistoric_description: Gain {Appeal-1} for each Prehistoric icon in your zoo.
abilities.jumping_description: Advance the break token {} spaces. Gain {Money-{}}.
abilities.inventive_bear_description: Gain {} {XToken} -token for each bear icon in all zoos (max.3).
abilities.inventive_primary_description: Gain 1/2/3 {XToken} -tokens for 1/3/5 primate icons in your zoo.
abilities.boost_association_description: After finishing this action, you may place your Association Action card {AssociationActionCard} on {Slot-1} or {Slot-5} .
abilities.boost_building_description: After finishing this action, you may place your Building Action card {BuildActionCard} on {Slot-1} or {Slot-5} .
abilities.boost_card_description: After finishing this action, you may place your Card Action card {CardsActionCard} on {Slot-1} or {Slot-5} .
abilities.boost_sponsors_description: After finishing this action, you may place your Sponsors Action card {SponsorsActionCard} on {Slot-1} or {Slot-5} .
abilities.boost_animal_description: After finishing this action, you may place your Animal Action card {AnimalActionCard} on {Slot-1} or {Slot-5} .
abilities.action_association_description: After finishing this action, you may take the Association action {AssociationActionCard} .
abilities.action_building_description: After finishing this action, you may take the Building action {BuildActionCard} .
abilities.action_cards_description: After finishing this action, you may take the Card action {CardsActionCard} .
abilities.action_sponsors_description: After finishing this action, you may take the Sponsors Action {SponsorsActionCard} .
abilities.action_animal_description: After finishing this action, you may take the Animal action {AnimalActionCard} .
abilities.multiplier_association_description: Place 1 {MultiplierToken} on your Association Action card {AssociationActionCard} .
abilities.multiplier_building_description: Place 1 {MultiplierToken} on your Building Action card {BuildActionCard} .
abilities.multiplier_card_description: Place 1 {MultiplierToken} on your Card Action card {CardsActionCard} .
abilities.multiplier_sponsors_description: Place 1 {MultiplierToken} on your Sponsors Action card {SponsorsActionCard} .
abilities.multiplier_animal_description: Place 1 {MultiplierToken} on your Animal Action card {AnimalActionCard} .
abilities.iconic_animal_description: Gain {Appeal-1} for each {} icon in all zoos (max. 8).
abilities.resistance_description: Draw 2 Final Scoring cards. Keep 1 and discard the other.
abilities.assertion_description: You may add any 1 of the unused base conservation projects to your hand.
abilities.digging_description: Choose up to {}x: Discard 1 card from the display and replenish OR discard 1 card from your hand and draw 1 other from the deck.
abilities.sponsor_magnet_description: Add all sponsors cards from the display to your hand.
abilities.flock_animal_description: May share the existing enclosure of a {HerbivoreTag} with {Size-X+}.
abilities.dominance_description: You may add the base conservation project Primates to your hand if it is not already in the game.
abilities.pilfering_1_description: Draw 1 card from the hand of or take {Money-5} from the player with the most {Appeal}. They decide.
abilities.pilfering_2_description: From both the player with the highest {Appeal} and the player with the most {ConservationPoint}, Draw 1 card from the hand of or take {Money-5} from that player. They decide.
abilities.snapping_1_description: Gain any 1 card from the display.
abilities.snapping_2_description: 2x: Gain any 1 card from the display. You may replenish in between.
abilities.venom_description: Each player ahead of you on the Appeal track gains {} Venom token(s).
abilities.constriction_description: Each player ahead of you on a track gains 1 Constriction token for each of those tracks ( {Appeal} and {ConservationPoint} ).
abilities.hypnosis_description: After finishing this action, you may take 1 action {ActionCard} from an Action card in slot {Slot-1} , {Slot-2} or {Slot-3} of the player with the most {Appeal}.
abilities.scavenging_description: Shuffle the discard pile and draw {} cards. Add 1 to your hand and discard the other.
abilities.posturing_description: Up to {}x: You may place 1 free kiosk or pavilion.
abilities.perception_2_description: Draw 2 cards from the deck. Add 1 to your hand and discard the rest.
abilities.perception_4_description: Draw 4 cards from the deck. Add 2 to your hand and discard the rest.
abilities.determination_description: After finishing this action, you take 1 other action {ActionCard} .
abilities.peacocking_description: You may place a Large Bird Aviary {LargeBirdAviary} for free, if possible.
abilities.petting_zoo_animal_description: Gain {Appeal-3} for each Petting Zoo Animal icon in your zoo.
abilities.mark_description: After finishing this action, mark 1 Animal card in the display.
abilities.trade_description: You may trade exactly 1 {XToken} -Marker for {Money-5} or vice versa.
abilities.sea_animal_magnet_description: Add all cards with the {SeaAnimalTag} icon from the display to your hand.
abilities.symbiosis_description: Use 1 ability (not a Reef Dweller effect) of 1 other {SeaAnimalTag} card in your zoo.
abilities.helpful_description: No Reef Dweller effect of its own.
abilities.extra_shift_description: You may return 1 of your association workers to your notepad.
abilities.glide_description:
Discard up to {} cards from your hand: For every {SeaAnimalTag} icon on them, gain 1 of these 3 effects:
{Reputation-1} / {Appeal-2} / {Kiosk} .
abilities.shark_attack_description: Discard {} Animal card(s) in reputation range from the display: Gain half the {Appeal} of those cards (round down).
abilities.cut_down_description: You may remove 1 empty standard enclosure from your zoo map and gain back its cost.
abilities.camouflage_description: If you play 1 other animal during this turn, you may ignore 1 of its conditions
abilities.scuba_dive_description: Reveal the X topmost cards of the deck. Choose 1 Sponsor card and add it to your hand. Discard the other cards. X is the number of {SeaAnimalTag} + {ReptileTag} in your zoo.
abilities.adapt_description: Draw {} Final Scoring cards, then discard {} Final Scoring cards.
abilities.monkey_gang_description: Reveal cards from the deck. Take the first card with {PrimateTag} into your hand. Tuck the other cards under the deck.
abilities.water_affinity_description: Gain {Appeal-2} if the petting zoo is adjacent to a water space.
abilities.rumbling_description: You may flip a standard enclosure of {Size-X-} or less. If occupied, gain back its cost.
abilities.ancestor_description: Place your player token on the lowest available bonus space on the research track.

sponsors.s201_desc1: Take 1 card from the deck or in reputation range.
sponsors.s201_desc2: Take 1 card from the deck or in reputation range.
sponsors.s202_desc1: Each time you play a research icon into your zoo, gain {Reputation-1} .
sponsors.s203_desc1: Supporting a conservation project requires only {Slot-4} .
sponsors.s204_desc1: Each time you play a research icon into your zoo, gain {ConservationPoint-1} .
sponsors.s207_desc1: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} each for 2 different continent and/or animal category icons. For each {ConservationPoint-1} that you gain this way, all other players gain {Money-2} .
sponsors.s208_desc1: Each time a research icon is played into any zoo, gain {Money-2} .
sponsors.s208_desc3: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for 5 different animal category icons.
sponsors.s210_desc1: Each time you play an Americas icon into your zoo, you may build 1 kiosk for free.
sponsors.s211_desc1: Each time you play a Europe icon into your zoo, you may build a 1-space enclosure for free.
sponsors.s212_desc1: Each time you play an Australia icon into your zoo, you may place 1 card from your hand under this card to gain {Appeal-2} (pouch 1).
sponsors.s213_desc1: Each time you play an Asia icon into your zoo, you may build 1 pavilion for free.
sponsors.s214_desc1: Each time you play an Africa icon into your zoo, you may place any action card on {Slot-1} .
sponsors.s215_desc1: When playing this card, place 2 player tokens on it. When supporting a **base** conservation project, you may discard exactly 1 token as any icon.
sponsors.s215_desc2:
Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for 5
supports of
conservation projects.
sponsors.s217_desc1:
Each time you build at least 1 building with a Build action {BuildActionCard} . you may build exactly 1 more of the same kind (except for special enclosures)
at the normal cost.
sponsors.s218_desc1: When playing this card, place 2 player tokens on it. When supporting a **base** conservation project, you may discard exactly 1 token as any icon.
sponsors.s218_desc2:
Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for 5
supports of
conservation projects.
sponsors.s219_desc1: You may build over water and rock spaces. Ignore all requirements for water and rock spaces.
sponsors.s219_desc2: Gain {Money-2} for each water and rock requirement.
sponsors.s221_desc1: Each time you gain the placement bonus of a border space in your zoo, you additionally gain another free placement bonus.
sponsors.s222_desc1: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} each for each research icon. For each {ConservationPoint-1} that you gain this way, all other players gain {Money-2} .
sponsors.s224_desc1: Each time you support a Release into the Wild conservation project, additionally gain {ConservationPoint-1} . You may support every Release into the Wild conservation project more than once.
sponsors.s225_desc1: The effects of Venom, Constriction, Hypnosis, and Pilfering do not affect you.
sponsors.s227_desc1: Choose and mark on this card. Successively reveal cards from the deck and take the first card of the chosen kind.
sponsors.s227_desc2: You must not play the other kind any more. Each time you play a small or large animal, you gain {Appeal-2} or {Appeal-4} respectively.
sponsors.s228_desc1:
Each time you play only small animals in the Animals action {AnimalActionCard} , you may play 1 further small animal at the normal cost. After that, take 1 small animal from the
display (if available).
sponsors.s229_desc1: Your cost to play a small animal is reduced by {Money-3} .
sponsors.s230_desc1: Your cost to play a large animal is reduced by {Money-4} .
sponsors.s231_desc1:
**Income:**
Gain {Money-3} / {Money-6} / {Money-9} for 1/3/5 primate icons in your zoo.
sponsors.s232_desc1:
**Income:**
Gain {Money-3} / {Money-6} / {Money-9} for 1/3/5 reptile icons in your zoo.
sponsors.s233_desc1:
**Income:**
Gain {Money-3} / {Money-6} / {Money-9} for 1/3/5 bird icons in your zoo.
sponsors.s234_desc1:
**Income:**
Gain {Money-3} / {Money-6} / {Money-9} for 1/3/5 predator icons in your zoo.
sponsors.s235_desc1:
**Income:**
Gain {Money-3} / {Money-6} / {Money-9} for 1/3/5 herbivore icons in your zoo.
sponsors.s236_desc1: Each time a primate icon is played into **any** zoo, gain {Money-3} .
sponsors.s237_desc1: Each time a reptile icon is played into **any** zoo, gain {Money-3} .
sponsors.s238_desc1: Each time a bird icon is played into **any** zoo, gain {Money-3} .
sponsors.s239_desc1: Each time a predator icon is played into **any** zoo, gain {Money-3} .
sponsors.s240_desc1: Each time a herbivore icon is played into **any** zoo, gain {Money-3} .
sponsors.s241_desc1: For each space you cover that is next to a water space, gain {Money-1} .
sponsors.s241_desc3: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} , if all water spaces are connected.
sponsors.s242_desc1: For each space you cover that is next to a rock space, gain {Money-1} .
sponsors.s242_desc3: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} , if all rock spaces are connected.
sponsors.s243_desc1: Each time you play a herbivore icon into your zoo, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.s243_desc3: Place next to at least 1 rock space.
sponsors.s244_desc1: Each time you play a bird icon into your zoo, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.s244_desc3: Place next to at least 1 water space.
sponsors.s245_desc1: Each time you play a water icon into your zoo, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.s245_desc3: Place next to at least 2 water spaces.
sponsors.s246_desc1: Each time you play a rock icon into your zoo, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.s246_desc3: Place next to at least 2 rock spaces.
sponsors.s247_desc1: Each time you play a primate icon into your zoo, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.s247_desc3: Place next to at least 1 rock space.
sponsors.s248_desc1: Each time you play a primate icon into your zoo, gain 1 {XToken} -token.
sponsors.s249_desc1: Each time you play a bird icon into your zoo, draw 2 cards from the deck. Keep 1 and discard the other (Perception 2).
sponsors.s250_desc1: Each time you play a reptile icon into your zoo, you may sell up to 2 cards from your hand for each (Sunbathing 2).
sponsors.s251_desc1: Each time a bear icon is played into any zoo, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.s252_desc1: Each time you play a predator icon into your zoo, reveal the topmost X cards of the deck. Add 1 animal card to your hand. Discard the other cards. (X = number of your predator icons) .
sponsors.s253_desc1: Place 3 player tokens on this card. Each time you play a Herbivore icon into your zoo, you may remove 1 token and play a sponsors card for {Money-X} ( {Money-X} = {Slot-X} ).
sponsors.s254_desc1: Place on at least 2 border spaces. Take 1 card from the deck or in reputation range.
sponsors.s255_desc1: Place next to at least 1 rock space.
sponsors.s256_desc1: Place next to at least 1 water space.
sponsors.s257_desc1: Place on 2 border spaces. Need not be adjacent to other buildings.
sponsors.s257_desc2: **Income:** Gain {Money-2} for each building, except empty standard enclosures, next to the side entrance.
sponsors.s257_desc3: Gain {Appeal-5} if zoo is completely covered.
sponsors.s258_desc1: Gain {Appeal-1} for each connected water space.
sponsors.s258_desc2: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for each 2 unconnected water spaces.
sponsors.s259_desc1: Gain {Appeal-1} for each connected rock space.
sponsors.s259_desc2: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for each 2 unconnected rock spaces.
sponsors.s260_desc1: Gain {Appeal-1} for each connected border space without buildings.
sponsors.s260_desc2: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for each group of 6 spaces without buildings.
sponsors.s261_desc1: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for 5 different animal category icons.
sponsors.s262_desc1: Each time you gain a continent or animal category icon that is not yet in your zoo, gain {Appeal-1} and {Money-2} .
sponsors.s262_desc2: {Money-2} for each different continent or animal category icon in your zoo.
sponsors.s263_desc1: If you play a large animal, you may ignore 1 condition of your choice.
sponsors.s263_desc2: You may place 1 5-space enclosure for free.
sponsors.s264_desc1: Gain {Appeal-1} for each connected space with a placement bonus.
sponsors.s264_desc2: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for each 2 unconnected spaces with a placement bonus.
sponsors.s265_desc1: Gain {Money-1} for each kiosk in other zoos.
sponsors.s266_desc1:
Each time a sea animal icon
is played into any zoo, gain {Money-3} .
sponsors.s267_desc1: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for each {Kiosk} with at least 3 empty building spaces next to it (max. {ConservationPoint-3} ).
sponsors.s268_desc1: Each time you play a Europe icon into your zoo, you may mark 1 Animal card after finishing the current action.
sponsors.s269_desc1: Each time you play an Australia icon into your zoo, you may increase the size of a standard enclosure by 1 for free. If the enclosure is occupied, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.s270_desc1:
**Expedition** | You may send a **person**
Sponsor card in your zoo away (discard) to gain {ConservationPoint-1}
OR
**Scuba** **Dive** **3** | Reveal the 3 topmost cards of the deck. Choose 1 Sponsor card and add it to your hand. Discard the other cards.
sponsors.s271_desc1: Gain placement bonuses twice for placing this building.
sponsors.s271_desc2: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} if all placement bonuses are covered.
sponsors.s272_desc1: Treat all 3-space enclosures on at least 1 border space as 5-space enclosures.
sponsors.s272_desc2: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} if all border spaces are covered.
sponsors.s273_desc1: When making a donation, pay {Money-1} less for each {ScienceIcon} in your zoo.
sponsors.s274_desc2: Gain {Appeal-2} for each zoo with higher appeal (score last).
sponsors.s275_desc1: Each time a Petting Zoo Animal icon is played into **any** **zoo** , gain {Money-2} .
sponsors.s275_desc2: Search the **discard** **pile** for 1 Petting Zoo Animal and take it into hand.
sponsors.s276_desc1: Each time you build a pavilion, gain 1 {XToken} -marker (max. 1 per action).
sponsors.s278_desc1: Place next to at least 1 water space and 1 rock space.
sponsors.s280_desc1: Do not gain placement bonuses anymore.
sponsors.s280_desc2: You may reposition up to 3 buildings. You may build 1 pavilion and 1 kiosk.
sponsors.s281_desc2: Gain 2 {Appeal-2} for each zoo with less appeal (score first).
sponsors.s282_desc2: Each time a **person** Sponsor card is played into **any** **zoo** , gain {Money-2} and {Appeal-1} .

about.title: About This Site
about.intro:
This is an open-source unofficial website of the board game Ark Nova. It is not affiliated with Capstone Games in any way.
This project gets inspiration from ssimeonoff's website and for players to easily search for cards and their effects. The initial data for this site is sourced from <1>Cillie's List of animal cards</1>, while the icons and styles were borrowed from <3>BGA</3>. If there are any copyright concerns, I will address them.

features.title: Features
features.intro: Currently, this site has the following features:
features.li_1: All animal and sponsor cards in base game and Marine World expansion
features.li_3: Filters for tags, requirements, keywords and so on
features.li_5: Rating and comments for each card
features.plan_intro: In the future, I plan to add the following features:

thanks.title: Thanks
thanks.translation: Thanks for the following players for helping with translation: 小z, 晓慜, Yannick, Propaganda Panda，klingeling，sebhoron，Mengyantong，emmanuel7151.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q_1: How can I assist with the translation?
faq.a_1: Nice! You can follow the instructions <1>here</1>.
faq.q_2: Is this website created for commercial purposes?
faq.a_2: No, it's a open-source website dedicated to this fantastic game. Original images and texts belong to Capstone Games. f there are any copyright concerns, I will address them.
faq.q_3: What if I have another question, suggestion, or bug report related to this website?
faq.a_3: Feel free to comment in the <1>BGG thread</1> or submit an issue at <3>GitHub</3>.

diy.bug: This function has a unsolved bug. Please do not delete original abilities before your customized abilities.

maps.alternative_desc: Check the <1>post</1> for more information. You can now switch between the original and alternative maps.
maps.desc1-1: Gain 2 Appeals every time you flip a standard enclosure to its occupied side next to the Observation Tower.
maps.desc1-2: The enclosure must be adjacent to the space with the tower, not merely to any one of the other 3 rock spaces.
maps.desc1-3: The platform has no effect on special enclosures.
maps.desc1-4: If you release an animal into the wild (and thus flip an occupied enclosure back to the empty side) and then accommodate a new animal in this enclosure, you gain the 2 appeal again. The Observation Tower itself does not count as a building (e. g. for kiosks).
maps.desc2-1: Each standard enclosure adjacent to Gates has +2 capacity.
maps.desc2-2: After placing any standard enclosure adjacent to the Outdoor Areas, you treat it as if it were 2 spaces larger for all purposes (e. g. release).
maps.desc2-3: The enclosure must be adjacent to the space with the Outdoor Area, not merely to any one of the other 4 water spaces.
maps.desc2-4: The Outdoor Area itself is not considered a building (e. g. for kiosks).
maps.desc4-1: Active if Harbor is connected: Once during your turn, you may discard 1 hand card for 3 Money (at any time).
maps.desc4-2: The Commercial Harbor is considered to be connected as soon as you have placed a building on the adjacent building space.
maps.desc4-3: You may use the ability at any time during your turn, before, after, or during an action. However, you may only discard 1 card with the Commercial Harbor per turn. You may not use the ability during a break or someone else’s turn. The Commercial Harbor itself does not count as a building (e. g. for kiosks).
maps.desc5-1: Income: gain 1 Money income for each covered space adjacent to the Restaurant.
maps.desc5-2: The left bonus: you can build 1 of the 2 depicted special enclosures in your zoo for free, even if you did not upgrade the Build Action card yet.
maps.desc5-3:
During the break, you gain income of 1 money for each space adjacent to the Park Restaurant with
a building on it. It does not matter if these are single buildings or if several spaces belong to the same building. It also doesn’t matter what kind of buildings you build there and whether
enclosures are occupied or not. The Park Restaurant itself does not count as a building (e. g. for kiosks).
maps.desc6-1: Active if Institute is connected: Each time you play an animal card, ignore 1 condition of your choice.
maps.desc6-2: The Research Institute is considered connected as soon as you have placed a building on the adjacent building space. You may build your first building directly adjacent to the Research Institute, but you do not have to. Once active, you can play Animal cards even when you are 1 condition short; you must still fulfill all other conditions. You cannot ignore rock or water requirements.
maps.desc7-1: All kiosk placement bonuses covered: Income: Gain 1 Money extra income for each kiosk
maps.desc7-2:
If you have covered all parlors, you gain 1 additional money for each kiosk on your zoo map as income
during the break. It does not matter if these kiosks were built as placement bonuses or by other means. It also does not matter if they generate income without this bonus or not.
maps.desc8-1: Each time you cover an H, reveal cards from the deck and add the first Sponsor card to your hand. All H covered: Each Sponsor card Strength decrease 1 when played.
maps.desc8-2: The left bonus: if you have not yet upgraded the Association Action card, you can not gain a third partner zoo.
maps.desc8-3: Spaces with an H may be covered like any other space. This is similar to a placement bonus, but does not count as one (e. g. for card 221). Every time you place a building on an H, reveal cards from the deck one by one until you reveal a Sponsor card. Add this card to your hand and put all other revealed cards onto the discard pile. Once you have covered all 3 spaces, the level of each Sponsor card you play is 1 lower. This means you can play them more easily.
maps.desc9-1: This zoo map has 5 areas of 6 spaces each. Each of these areas is color coded to a specific continent. At the start of the game, place 1 player marker each on the 5 spaces that belong to those areas. These spaces are also color coded to the continent and have a black outline of the respective continent on white ground next to it.
maps.desc9-2: When you play an animal into your zoo and at least 1 space of the enclosure you put the animal in is in the area belonging to the same continent as the animal, then you may remove the player marker from that continent area and get one of the 5 bonuses depicted. Put the marker back into your supply. It does not matter whether the enclosure is a standard enclosure or a special enclosure.
maps.desc9-3: You can gain the bonus once per continent icon/area. If you have already removed the player marker before, you cannot gain the bonus for this continent again.
maps.desc9-4: Each time you gain a bonus, you can choose any 1 of the 5 bonuses. So you can take the same bonus multiple times during the game. When you remove the 5th and final player marker, you gain 1 Conservation point in addition to the bonus you get.
maps.desc9-5: The left bonus: When you take this bonus on the left side of your zoo map, you can remove any 1 player marker from 1 of the 5 continent areas (without having to play a matching animal). Gain 1 bonus as usual (plus 1 Conservation point if this was the 5th and final player marker you removed).
maps.desc9-6: When using the Flock Animal ability, you cannot gain a continent bonus (because you do not use a specific enclosure). When you build this special building and move an animal from a standard enclosure into it, you can gain the continent bonus if the animal moved shares a continent symbol with an area this building is in.
maps.desc10-1: When gaining this placement bonus, you gain Digging 1: Choose up to 1× : EITHER discard 1 card from the display and replenish OR discard 1 card from your hand and draw 1 other from the deck.
maps.desc10-2: If the discarded card is an animal card (except for a Petting Zoo animal ), you may slide it underneath your zoo map from the top, at one of the 3 slots marked by an arrow that does not have a card yet, so that only the top of the card is visible. The animal counts as “in your zoo” from that moment on and triggers any other card that looks for icons or animals being played into your zoo. Ignore the rest of the card. That means you do not gain any effects from the animal card itself.
maps.desc10-3: You can have up to 3 cards at the top of your zoo map. If you gain the bonus more than 3 times, for example because of Sponsor card 221, Archaeologist, you cannot replace one of the cards with a new card. In that case you can only use Digging 1.
maps.desc10-4: You do not need to fulfill any conditions depicted on the animal card. You do not need to pay the money cost. The animal card does not need an enclosure. Any enclosure requirements still count as in your zoo (since they are also icons).
maps.desc10-5: If the animal card is a large or small animal, it also counts as such in your zoo. You may not release the animal into the Wild.
maps.descA-1: You start with a free size-3 enclosure and a kiosk in the bottom left corner. No special ability.
maps.desc11-1: Store: Place 1 hand card under your notepad (can be taken back into your hand at ant time). During each break, gain 2 money per stored card.
maps.desc12-1: Conceal the leftmost open action strength (the "3") always remains open). Action strength is increased to the next highest visible number.
maps.desc13-1: If you completely cover an area on your mao, immediately and during each break gain the depicted bonus.
maps.desc14-1: Find a person Sponsor card (including 1x at start of game) and take it into your hand.
maps.descT1-1: Active if left top bonus unlocked: once during your turn, you may discard 1 hand card to increase the strength of an action by +1.

endgame.desc7: Gain {ConservationPoint} for the **reputation** of your zoo.
endgame.desc9-1: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for each **animal** **category** **icon** of which you have more than the person to your right. Max. {ConservationPoint-4} .
endgame.desc13: Choose 1 **continent** **icon** you did **not** **support** a **Base** **Conservation** **Project** with. Gain {ConservationPoint} for those icons.
endgame.desc14: Choose 1 **animal** **category** **icon** you did **not** **support** a **Base** **Conservation** **Project** with. Gain {ConservationPoint} for those icons.
endgame.desc15: Gain {ConservationPoint} for **sets** **of** **kiosk** **and** **pavilion** (do not have to be adjacent).
endgame.desc17-1: Gain {ConservationPoint-1} for each **continent** **icon** of which you have more than the person to your right. Icons on **your** **partner** **zoos** count **twice** . Max. {ConservationPoint-4} .

project.desc_101: Requires different **animal** **category** icons in your zoo.
project.desc_102: Requires different **continent** icons in your zoo.
project.desc_113:
**Release** 1 animal with
**Europe** icon into the wild.
project.desc_114:
**Release** 1 animal with
**Americas** icon into the wild.
project.desc_115:
**Release** 1 animal with
**Asia** icon into the wild.
project.desc_116:
**Release** 1 animal with
**Africa** icon into the wild.
project.desc_117:
**Release** 1 animal with
**Australia** icon into the wild.
project.desc_123:
Requires 1 **bird** and a **partner**
**zoo** of the same continent.
project.desc_124:
Requires 1 **predator** and a **partner**
**zoo** of the same continent.
project.desc_125:
Requires 1 **reptile** and a **partner**
**zoo** of the same continent.
project.desc_126:
Requires 1 **herbivore** and a **partner**
**zoo** of the same continent.
project.desc_127:
Requires 1 **primate** and a **partner**
**zoo** of the same continent.

sponsors.31_desc1: Each time a Prehistoric animal icon is played into **any** zoo, gain {Money-3} .
sponsors.31_desc2: Gain {Appeal-1} for each Prehistoric animal icon in your zoo.
sponsors.32_desc1: Each time you play an electrical icon into **your** zoo, advance the research marker 4 spaces.
sponsors.32_desc2: You may place 1 free electrical substation adjacent to at least 1 electrical space.
sponsors.33_desc1: Each time you play a Prehistoric animal icon into **your** zoo, gain {Appeal-2} .
sponsors.33_desc2: Place adjacent to at least 1 rock space and 1 electrical space.
sponsors.34_desc1: Gain {Appeal-1} for each building space adjacent to an electrical substation.
sponsors.34_desc2: Gain {Appeal-1} for each rock space adjacent to an electrical substation.
sponsors.35_desc1: Place your player token on the lowest available bonus space on the research track.
sponsors.35_desc2: **Income:** Gain the bonus where your player token is located on the research track.
sponsors.36_desc1: When discarding cards due to hand limit, cards with Prehistoric animal icons may be revealed instead of discarded.
sponsors.36_desc2: Redistribute your player tokens on genetic editing without the no-repeat restriction.
sponsors.36_desc3: If your research marker is at position 6 or higher on the research track, gain {ConservationPoint-1} .

actions.title: Marine World Variant Action Cards
actions.build_common_blue_1: Build 1 building with a maximum size of X.
actions.build_common_blue_3: Buildable: Kiosk, Pavilion, Aquarium, Standard Enclosure, Petting Zoo.
actions.build_1_blue_1: Build 1 building with a maximum size of X.
actions.build_1_blue_4: You may pay 3 to build 1 additional Pavilion.
actions.build_1_pink_1: Build 1 or more different buildings with a total maximum size of X.
actions.build_1_pink_4: You may pay 2 to build 1 additional Pavilion.
actions.build_1_white_1: Level I: You may build 1 additional Pavilion. Even if you already built a Pavilion in this action, or this Pavilion would exceed your action strength by 1, you may still do so. Pay a total of 3 for this additional Pavilion (2 regular cost plus 1 additional cost). You may build all buildings in any order you choose (including the additional Pavilion).
actions.build_1_white_2: Level II: Same as Level I, but the cost of the additional Pavilion is reduced to 2 (regular cost).
actions.build_2_blue_1: Build 1 building with a maximum size of X.
actions.build_2_blue_4: You may pay 3 to build 1 additional Kiosk.
actions.build_2_pink_1: Build 1 or more different buildings with a total maximum size of X.
actions.build_2_pink_4: You may pay 2 to build 1 additional Kiosk.
actions.build_2_white_1: Level I: You may build 1 additional Kiosk. Even if you already built a Kiosk in this action, or this Kiosk would exceed your action strength by 1, you may still do so. Pay a total of 3 for this additional Kiosk (2 regular cost plus 1 additional cost). You may build all buildings in any order you choose (including the additional Kiosk).
actions.build_2_white_2: Level II: Same as Level I, but the cost of the additional Kiosk is reduced to 2 (regular cost).
actions.build_3_blue_1: Build 1 building with a maximum size of X+1.
actions.build_3_pink_1: Build 1 or more different buildings with a total maximum size of X+1.
actions.build_3_pink_4: You may build multiple identical Standard Enclosures.
actions.build_3_white_1: Level I: You may build with strength X+1.
actions.build_3_white_2: Level II: Same as Level I, but you may build as many of each type of Standard Enclosure as you wish (X+1 strength limit still applies). This action does not allow you to build more than 1 Kiosk and 1 Pavilion.
actions.build_4_blue_4: You may pay 2 to cover 1 rock or water space.
actions.build_4_pink_4: You may cover 1 rock or water space. If you do, gain 2.
actions.build_4_white_1: Level I: You may pay 2 to cover 1 water or rock space as if it were a buildable space. This only applies to building with this action, not to any other way of building or placing unique buildings.
actions.build_4_white_2: Level II: Same as Level I, but when you cover a water or rock space, you gain 2 instead of paying 2. You may still only build on 1 water or rock space per action.
actions.build_common_pink_1: Build 1 or more different buildings with a total maximum size of X.
actions.build_common_pink_3: Additional buildable: Large Bird Aviary and Reptile House.
actions.animals_1_blue_2: Table: Strength 1 = 0; Strength 2/3/4 = 1; Strength 5 = 2 (or 1 can be -1)
actions.animals_1_blue_3: If you play only 1 animal at strength 5 or higher, you may ignore 1 condition.
actions.animals_1_pink_2: Table: Strength 1/2 = 1; Strength 3 = 2 (or 1 can be -1); Strength 4 = 2 (or 1 can be -1); Strength 5 = 1 Reputation+2 (or 1 Reputation+1 can be -1)
actions.animals_1_pink_3: If you play only 1 animal at strength 3 or higher, you may ignore 1 condition.
actions.animals_1_white_2: If the action strength allows you to play 2 Animal cards but you only play 1, you may ignore 1 condition on that Animal card. (Level I: Strength 5; Level II: Strength 3+)
actions.animals_2_blue_3: If you have no Animal cards in hand after this action: Hunter 4.
actions.animals_2_pink_3: If you have no Animal cards in hand after this action: Hunter 6.
actions.animals_2_white_2: After this action, you may reveal your hand to show you have no Animal cards. If you do, reveal the top X cards of the deck. Choose 1 Animal card and add it to your hand. Discard the rest. (Hunter X ability) (Level I: X=4 cards; Level II: X=6 cards)
actions.animals_3_blue_3: Reduce the cost of your first played animal by 2.
actions.animals_3_pink_3: Additionally, for each animal you play, you may pay 2 to gain 1 Appeal
actions.animals_3_white_2: Level I: Reduce the cost of the first animal played with this action by 2 (minimum 0).
actions.animals_3_white_3: Level II: For each animal you play with this action (once per animal), you may pay 2 additional to gain 1 additional Appeal. (Unlike Level I, you no longer get a discount on the first animal played.)
actions.animals_4_pink_3: When you play any marked Animal card from the display, gain 1 Reputation. (Mark)
actions.animals_4_white_2: Level I: After this action, place 1 of your player markers on an Animal card in the display that does not yet have any player markers. When a card with your player marker is discarded from the display, that card goes to your hand instead. When a card with your player marker leaves the display in any other way (drawn to hand, or played directly from the display by any player), you gain 2 from the supply. In either case, return your player marker to your supply. (Mark ability)
actions.animals_4_white_3: Level II: When playing a marked Animal card from the display, in addition to the 2 from the Mark ability, you also gain 1 Reputation. Then, after this action, perform the Mark animal ability.
actions.animals_common_white_1: At Level I, you may only play Animal cards from your hand. At Level II, you may also play Animal cards from within reputation range by paying the folder number as an additional cost.
actions.association_common_blue_1: Perform 1 Association task with a maximum task strength of X.
actions.association_common_pink_1: Perform 1 or more different Association tasks with a total maximum task strength of X.
actions.association_common_white_1: At Level I, you may support 1 conservation project that is in play or from your hand. At Level II, you may also play conservation project cards from within reputation range by paying the folder number as an additional cost.
actions.association_1_blue_2: Take a Partner Zoo from the supply (not from the Association board).
actions.association_1_blue_3: You may take a Partner Zoo you already have.
actions.association_1_pink_3: Take Partner Zoos and Universities from the supply.
actions.association_1_pink_4: You may take those you already have.
actions.association_1_white_2: Level I: If you use this action to take a Partner Zoo, you must take it from the supply, not from the Association board. You may take a Partner Zoo you already have (even if you already have multiple). If there are no Partner Zoos in the supply, you can no longer take it, even if there are still Partner Zoos on the Association board. If you have multiple Partner Zoos from the same continent, each reduces the cost of playing each animal from that continent.
actions.association_1_white_3: Level II: Same as Level I, but also applies to Universities. You may also take any still available new Universities. Take from beside the Association board, leaving the generic University in place. Having multiple Universities that raise your hand limit to 5 does not further increase your hand limit.
actions.association_2_blue_2: At strength 5, you may hire 1 new Association worker instead of supporting a conservation project. (Place the new worker at strength 5)
actions.association_2_pink_3: You may place additional workers to reduce the required strength, each additional worker reduces strength by 2.
actions.association_2_white_2: Level I: When performing a conservation project work task, you may hire an Association worker instead of supporting a conservation project. Place the new worker next to the worker performing the task. In the next break, return these workers to your notepad. You cannot perform the same task again before the break because you already have 2 Association workers there. You do not need to be able to support a conservation project to hire a new worker instead.
actions.association_2_white_3: Level II: When performing an Association task, you may place 1 additional worker to reduce the strength requirement by 2. You may do this multiple times.
actions.association_3_blue_2: If X is higher than the strength of the performed task, gain 1 X token.
actions.association_3_pink_3: For each X token you have, pay 1 less.
actions.association_3_white_2: Level I: If your action strength is higher than the strength required for your task (not just equal), gain 1 X token.
actions.association_3_white_3: Level II: Each time you use this action to make a donation, pay 1 less for each X token on your notepad (minimum 0). You do not discard X tokens.
actions.association_4_blue_2: At strength 5, you may place this action card at strength 1 and perform another action instead.
actions.association_4_pink_3: You may take a card from the deck or within reputation range instead of donating.
actions.association_4_white_2: Level I: When using this action card at strength 5, you may choose to do nothing and move the action card to slot 1, then perform another action after this (Determination ability). You do not need to have Association workers on your notepad to perform this action.
actions.association_4_white_3: Level II: You may take 1 card from the deck or within reputation range instead of making a donation. Do this at the end of the Association action, and you must have performed at least 1 Association task in this action to do so (just as if you were making a donation).
actions.cards_common_white_1: At Level I, you may only draw cards from the deck. At Level II, you may draw cards from the deck or within reputation range.
actions.cards_1_blue_3: Or Snap: Only at strength 5, snap 1 card from within reputation range.
actions.cards_1_pink_2: Table: Draw: Strength 1 = 1; Strength 2/3 = 2; Strength 4 = 3; Strength 5 = 4.
actions.cards_1_pink_3: Or Snap: At strength 3/4/5, snap 1 card from within reputation range.
actions.cards_1_white_2: Regardless of your action strength, keep all drawn cards. You do not need to discard cards.
actions.cards_2_blue_4: Or Snap: Only at strength 5, snap 1 card from within reputation range.
actions.cards_2_pink_2: Table: Draw: Strength 1 = 1; Strength 2/3 = 2; Strength 4 = 3; Strength 5 = 4.
actions.cards_2_pink_4: Or Snap: At strength 3/4/5, snap 1 card from within reputation range.
actions.cards_2_white_2: Choose up to X times: Discard 1 card from the display and replenish the display; OR discard 1 card from your hand to draw 1 card from the deck (Digging effect). Do this before drawing new cards. (Level I: X=1; Level II: X=2)
actions.cards_3_blue_4: Or Snap: At strength 3/4/5, snap 1 card from within reputation range.
actions.cards_3_pink_4: Or Snap: At strength 2/3/4, snap 1 card from within reputation range; at strength 5, snap 2 cards.
actions.cards_3_white_2: You may snap instead of drawing cards at lower than normal strength (Level I: Strength 3+; Level II: Strength 2+).
actions.cards_3_white_3: Level II: When your action strength is 5, you may snap 2 cards. Do not replenish during snapping.
actions.cards_4_blue_4: Or Snap: Only at strength 5, snap 1 card from within reputation range.
actions.cards_4_blue_5: Pay 2: To place any action card on card slot 1.
actions.cards_4_pink_2: Table: Draw: Strength 1 = 1; Strength 2/3 = 2; Strength 4 = 3; Strength 5 = 4.
actions.cards_4_pink_4: Or Snap: At strength 3/4/5, snap 1 card from within reputation range.
actions.cards_4_pink_5: Place any action card on card slot 1.
actions.cards_4_white_2: Level I: After this action, you may pay 2 to place any action card on card slot 1 (Clever effect).
actions.cards_4_white_3: Level II: Same as Level I, but you do not need to pay money to place the action card on card slot 1.
actions.sponsors_common_white_1: At Level I, you may only play Sponsor cards from your hand. At Level II, you may also play cards from within reputation range by paying the folder number as an additional cost.
actions.sponsors_1_blue_2: Play 1 Sponsor card with a maximum level of X.
actions.sponsors_1_blue_4: Break X, gain X money. Additionally, you may trade 1 X token for 5 money, or vice versa.
actions.sponsors_1_pink_1: Play 1 or more Sponsor cards with a total maximum level of X+1.
actions.sponsors_1_pink_4: Additionally, you may trade 1 X token for 5 money, or vice versa; or pay either to gain 1 Reputation.
actions.sponsors_1_white_2: Level I: In addition to your action, you may pay 1 X token to gain 5 money; or pay 5 money to gain 1 X token. You may do this before or after your Sponsor action. You may do this regardless of whether you play Sponsor cards or choose the break option. You cannot use newly gained X tokens to increase this Sponsor action strength.
actions.sponsors_1_white_3: Level II: Same as Level I, or you may pay 1 X token or 5 money to gain 1 Reputation.
actions.sponsors_2_blue_1: Play 1 Sponsor card with a maximum level of X.
actions.sponsors_2_blue_4: If you gain money in this action, gain 3 additional money.
actions.sponsors_2_pink_1: Play 1 or more Sponsor cards with a total maximum level of X+1.
actions.sponsors_2_pink_4: If you gain money in this action, gain 5 additional money.
actions.sponsors_2_white_2: When you gain money from this Sponsor action, gain X additional money (regardless of amount and source). This includes using the break option, playing Sponsor cards that give you money, and any money-giving effects triggered by Sponsor cards you play. (Level I: X=3 money; Level II: X=5 money)
actions.sponsors_3_blue_1: Play 1 Sponsor card with a maximum level of X.
actions.sponsors_3_blue_4: Additionally, you may discard 1 Sponsor card to gain 4 money.
actions.sponsors_3_pink_1: Play 1 or more Sponsor cards with a total maximum level of X+1.
actions.sponsors_3_pink_4: Additionally, you may discard 1 card: gain 4 money, or reduce a card to be played by strength 2.
actions.sponsors_3_white_2: Level I: In addition to your action, you may discard 1 Sponsor card to gain 4 money. You may do this before or after your Sponsor action. You may do this regardless of whether you play Sponsor cards or choose the break option.
actions.sponsors_3_white_3: Level II: Same as Level I, but you may discard any card (not just Sponsor cards) to gain 4 money (as in Level I), or reduce the level of a Sponsor card you play with this action by 2.
actions.sponsors_4_blue_1: Play 1 Sponsor card with a maximum level of X.
actions.sponsors_4_blue_4: Additionally, you may discard 1 Sponsor card to take 1 Sponsor card from the display into your hand.
actions.sponsors_4_pink_1: Play 1 or more Sponsor cards with a total maximum level of X+1.
actions.sponsors_4_pink_4: Instead of breaking, you may discard 1 card to play a Sponsor card and pay X money.
actions.sponsors_4_white_2: Level I: In addition to your action, you may discard 1 Sponsor card to snap any Sponsor card from the display. You may do this before or after your action. You may do this regardless of whether you play Sponsor cards or choose the break option.
actions.sponsors_4_white_3: Level II: When choosing the break option, you may discard any card (not just Sponsor cards) to play a Sponsor card from your hand and pay X money, where X equals the card level. You may do this before or after gaining money from the break option.
